basic_story.tagline: "leading the eco-luxury cosmetic revolution while empowering women and restoring our planet"
basic_story.story:
UNAKTI: Soil to Skin Soil supports 85% of life on Earth, and human health cannot be protected without the most basic sources of life functioning well. While the world is crumbling around us, we are taking action where is most needed. On a mission to restore human and planetary health, we focus our efforts on ecosystems regeneration, by preserving and recovering our natural resources while shining a light on conscious and 100% clean skincare products of the highest quality.My name is Susana Gago, I come from Spain, and after a career in the corporate world, I decided to pursue a more meaningful life. I moved to India looking for the rare and the unique, and launched my first venture in the sustainability space in 2006 "Miss monkey", a slow fashion brand that gained international recognition as a "hidden luxury brand".Fast forward, I acknowledge that even sustainability is not enough, and only regenerative practices that can restore our degraded ecosystems can bring the hope and solutions we all need.Although working in India as a woman and an outsider is beyond challenging, we’re doing great things in The Himalayas with a large network of women farmers, and we want to continue with the cultivation of high-value medicinal and aromatic plants via regenerative agroforestry projects and creating by-products for the wider use of ethnomedical, phytopharm and cosmetic industries around the world.By restoring land, we not only combat climate change by feeding the soil, sinking carbon, and attracting greater biodiversity, but also provide food and create income for the remote mountain communities we engage with.60% of every product we apply onto our skin, travels through the bloodstream to our internal organs, causing hormonal disruptions that can lead to health issues.Unfortunately, it's extremely rare (if not impossible), to find 100% natural, toxin-free products in the market, regardless of their claims.https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/toxic-beauty-poisoning-our-cosmetics-personal-care-products-gago/
Average grooming routine means we host a staggering 515 different synthetic chemicals in our bodies every single day.
These toxins build up over time and can gradually disrupt our hormonal release, break down the immune system and result in disease and health problems.
Over 25.000 chemicals are marketed with little government intervention.
UNAKTI productsBy creating waterfree or -anhydrous products, using 100% pure waxes, butters, and oil-soluble actives to replace the aqua, we reduce unnecessary harm to the environment and eliminate the need for synthetic/chemical preservatives.Our products have been lab-tested and certified as 100% natural, never witnessed before by the laboratory conducting the tests.What do our customers sayAnjali Malhotra, plastic surgeon "After about 6 months of using Unakti's Hairbloom oil, the difference in my hair is just phenomenal! Everyone around me has noticed that my hair has actually regrown! My hair was especially thin in the front and I would keep trying inventive ways to comb my hair to hide it. Today, I have thick, luxurious hair! The difference is actually unimaginable! After trying to find a product like thisfor so many years, I’d almost given up hope! This product has been nothing less than miraculous for me. Can’t recommend it highly enough!"

Yuca Devrese, surfer ( Roxy ambassador) "I was searching for sunscreen without any chemicals, just natural stuff! I’m eating natural food why should I put chemicals on the largest organ (skin) of my body? The color of Unakti's sunscreen is sweet purple, has a lovely smell, and is quite fluid. When I put it on my skin the texture feels thick but when I rub it out it feels like a real protecting layer on my skin, I love this feeling & it’s not sticky. After 2 hours of surfing my skin was not burned at all. After the surf and shower, my skin felt so good & smooth, baby-soft!. Knowing it is natural & no chemicals added I just want to use this lovely chocolate sunscreen every sunny day!"
 
We are a fem-powered team, sharing values and the desire to use business as a tool for the common good, bridging the gap between the grassroots and the final customer with total transparency and traceability.
By harnessing the power of Ayurveda and green nanotechnology, we've fused ancient skincare practices with modern bio-science to create a clean, nature-based, powerful, and effective line of luxury, cruelty-free skincare products, that have been tested over the last 4 years with extraordinary results.And by powering all our processes from the ground up, with 360^ newest technologies, we are building a supply chain that empowers the human and planetary experience, champions stewardship, and creates real change that is equitable, viable, profitable, and scalable.The tide is shifting also in the luxury sector having a brand new set of attributes:
Inside-out wellbeing and balance
Reconnection to the inner-self
Re-rooting, sense of belonging
Community enhancement
Preservation of the planet itself
Since plastic packaging is a leading cause of environmental damage, we have custom-designed, our sustainable, reusable, and biodegradable packaging and refills, that support biodiversity, currently under R&D.Our campaign GOALWe are raising eu 37000 as the first stepping stone on our fundraising journey. This amount will allow us to set up our legal structure, draft a solid supply chain plan and land assessment, prepare a compelling business plan to raise pre-seed funding from investors, and move forward with the research & development of our sustainable and biodegradable packaging, and our 2 first products (bee cream & chocolate sunscreen)A 5% of the amount raised, will be donated to Mount Valley Development Association (MVDA) in The Himalayas, an NGO that works towards improving the livelihoods of rural women.This will help them buy a cold-pressed machine for carrier oils and a steam-distillation machine for essential oils, so they can supply Unakti with some of their amazing ingredients for our cosmetics.Part of the amount raised will allow us to take the next steps towards the seed funding round, to cover the product launch on July 2022, and the first 18-month runway.Whichever amount we raise, will be strategically allocated with priority on legal, product, and people, while we move on with our conversations with investors for seed fundingYour support is crucial for our cause, and by supporting us, you’re supporting life.Claim our fantastic rewards below or make your good soul donations. All our contributors are invited to a guided visit to our plantations in The Himalayas.All products are to be delivered between February to July 30th following contributions order.If you just can't contribute, but you resonate with our mission, you can help by getting the word out using Indiegogo sharing tools.

0.question: 1- Are your products cruelty-free? You don’t test on animals, do you?
0.answer:
Nope. No way. Uh uh. Not ever.
TESTING ON ANIMALS IS UNNECESSARY AND BARBARIC.
We acquire the ingredients for our natural makeup and skincare from organic farms. That
means no synthetic, chemical herbicides, or pesticides

1.question: 2- What’s the shelf life of your products?
1.answer: All our products have a minimum two-year shelf-life

2.question: 3- You make a big thing about the purity of your ingredients, but how about preservatives, aren't they synthetic chemicals like most other Eco-brands?
2.answer:
We just don't touch synthetic compounds, we never have, and we never will.
Our proprietary preservative is 100% natural

3.question: 4- Why are your products made in India?
3.answer:
Being The Himalayas, one of the top ten biodiversities in the world, Susana Gago, the founder of Unaktishe has learned about the vast array of medicinal and aromatic plants nested on the immensely rich mountains.
State of the Art Manufacturing Plant:
Most of our products are manufactured in a purpose-built, state-of-the-art industrial plant in
India. The plant is GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) and Ayush certified.

4.question: 5- What differentiates your natural skincare products from other clean brands on the market?
4.answer:
Our Herbal extracts:
All herbs are grown and measured according to Ayurvedic scripts, 
Shade dried and hand pounded, to keep the valuable properties. We
don't use machine grinding as the temperature increase on the herbs will damage their properties.
The herbs are hand ponded until manipulated into fine nanoparticles. then we make herbal
extracts through steam distillation. That extract is converted into nano herbal extract called liposomes.
the entire process takes 1 to 10 weeks,

5.question: 6- Why nanotechnology on cosmetics?
5.answer:
Better UV protection, deeper skin penetration, and long-lasting effects. These nanoscale cosmetic ingredients possess active components readily absorbed into the skin, repair damage easily, and promote improved product outcomes.
These are some of the properties:
Increased stability and bio-absorption.
Enhanced bio-availability.
Sustained release of safer and efficacious herbal drugs.
Can cross anatomic barriers.
Precision targeted delivery.
Increased therapeutic value.

0.name: by Susana Gago Garcia
0.update:
Dear all
The campaign has come to an end.
It's been quite a revealing experience really.. we have managed to raise between this platform and the one on the malfunctioning Indian platform, some eu 9k. Far from the goal, but a small stepping stone.
There have been lots of good and bad surprises, as I thought it would. Some people who have compromised to support, didn't at all. Some asked for shares, and Robert Van Gasteren who was in the ambassadors team and had compromised to eu 1000 contribution, even sent a fake payment report. Shocking, yes.
On the bright side, it's all of you who have so kindly and generously supported Unakti on this crucial first step. I thank you warmly ???
Next move is field work in The Himalayas, land assessment and feseability plan. It's now the time for nursery work, and planning.
I've been contacted by a crowdfunding management computing the US who has proposed a partnership to relaunch a new campaign on commission basis. It would be them doing the hard work this time, preparation, building an audience, campaign content and design, marketing, campaign management and fundraising. Larger goal amount.
Anyhow, on this chaotic times, Regeneration becomes more important than ever!
Ive been awarded with a scholarship for"Regenerative Leadership Journey" by Laura Storm and the pioneers of the Regenerative movement around the world, so very grateful for that too. Really enjoying the course and I hope I get to improve my leadership capabilities for the very challenging future ahead.
And now, I've just received the raw ingredients from my Himalayan supplier to handcraft your wonderful products at my home lab, so I'll get on with it and I'm hoping to be able to send all by the end of March.
I'll keep you posted by mail, will be sharing some pics & videos with the farmers to keep you in the loop.
Be vigilant and stay alert, things are not as black and white as they're making us believe. While all these well-oschestrated distractions happen, our freedoms are at high risk. The European Parlament is trying to get all UN & NATO countries to sign up a treaty on pandemic prevention to the WHO. This is beyond anything they've done up to now. Meaning our freedom is been given away. No governments jurisdiction. One global health body. They'll be able to inject into us anything they want, anytime they want.
Watch our for what's happening behind the scenes.
 
Best wishes and warm hugs 
 
Susana

1.name: by Susana Gago Garcia
1.update:
Dear team 
And I say team, because the way I see it, anyone putting her/his money into the project, becomes in a way part of it as a venture builder.
We have completed our first week, raising EU 4.909, a 13% of the total goal amount, and 32 backers.
If we add the first achievements on day 1 on the previous platform, we account for EU 6.309 and total and 43 backers.
Providing that this has been done organically, and the issues faced with the previous Indian platform I'd say it's not too bad.. we are doing ok!
Could it be better? yes, of course, had we had decided to invest in ads, the performance would have been better, no doubt.
Yet, this is a conscious decision, based on the fact that I refuse to add wood to one of the biggest and deadliest fires that are burning the very fabric of our societies and enabling dictatorship and totalitarianism to gain ground and threaten our democracies: tech giants.
Clearly is a bit of a trap, we know that in order to gain exposure, hence buyer, we need to advertise. We've just engaged with a crowdfunding boosting agency instead, which does organic reposting, email campaigns, etc.
But hey, values and principles come for us, before profit.
Therefore, and up to now, I must say that Unakti has proudly spent ZERO on social media advertising.
We'll go slow, but we'll take a different route (at least until investment money is raised), then we'll have to see if we can actually maintain this policy.
My vision is for Unakti to grow slowly and organically, and to create a by-invite-only platform, in which we can create a vibrant community of like-minded individuals and have enriching discussions, and an array of interesting speakers from the health and wellness space we can learn from, who can guide us towards a more conscious way of living and how to fully regain the full spectrum of our health.
So, investing in education, rather than in advertising.
As campaign supporters, you'll receive your personal invites to the platform in due time.
Finally, I'd like to express my deepest gratitude once again for your support. I appreciate you.
 
We keep walking

2.name: by Susana Gago Garcia
2.update:
Dear friends
Thank you so much for your support today!
The first two days are crucial to driving traction and contributions, so I really appreciate you all, who have generously backed me up.
The journey has started quite bumpy really, as we tried launching 3 times before with an Indian platform which was a massive technical & human failure over ad over again.
So, the odds are clearly against us here, as we estimate we have lost some 80% of our potential backers who tried to contribute before and couldn't.
To be totally honest, launching a crowdfunding campaign is an extremely challenging and hard task, that takes us to the very tumultuous waters of asking for monetary support, and confirms the (according to me, undeniable fact), that only money people can raise money.
Therefore, you can understand how much I appreciate your support today and thank you sincerely for helping us raise a decent first-day amount of EU 2.280
I won't forget this.
I'll keep you posted with evolution.
May the force be with us!

basic_story.tagline: Help Preserve the Fountain of Unlimited Health Uniquely Found in Micro Communities Around the World
basic_story.story:
We still need contributions!
Even though we've hit our 2nd goal of $12,000 doesn't mean we're where we need to be. That was just an initial amount to make sure we hit our goal for Indiegogo to release our funds and allow us to still receive much-needed contributions after the campaign is over. 
 
✓ $5,000 ✓
We did it! Thanks, everyone :)
 
✓ $12,000 ✓
Wow, we just made it!! Now we can provide animals to all 3 villages! Everyone is so excited. We're putting the plan into action over the next couple of weeks so stay tuned.
 
$25,000
This will allow us to go beyond the 3 initial villages and turn this into a growing movement across Africa. Please help us reach this before the end of the year.
 
 

 
Help Preserve the Fountain of Unlimited Health Uniquely Found in Micro Communities Around the World
In a few places in the world, the natural state of our perfect health remains.  These communities provide a window of what is possible.  They show that illness (both chronic and immediate) is an unnatural state.  However, the health of these communities is under threat. 
Humanitarian and environmental efforts have begun to whittle away at their traditional diets and have encroached on their land.  The children are being fed a school lunch of water, beans, corn, sugar, and vegetable oil. 
If this continues, we will see the same decline in health that we have seen all over the world.  Soon, they too will think that chronic disease and ill-health are normal.  At Cows 4 Kids, our mission is to provide the school children with their traditional tribal diet and to help community members preserve their ancient dietary knowledge in a modern setting. 
Learn more about the positive impact we have and join us in bringing about Cows 4 Kids!
 

 
Here at Cows 4 Kids, we find that it is not good enough to reverse disease.  We are in the business of stopping it all together.  Each of the communities we support consumes a different traditional diet, yet they all maintain perfect health.  We provide them with the animals to continue their unique ancestral diets and keep their wisdom alive.
 

 
The Team
Mary Ruddick, Brian Sanders, and Jay Hanamura started Cows4Kids.com after a life changing trip to Tanzania and Uganda.  All three founding members have long worked toward reversing disease in the western world.  Upon seeing the perfect health of so many villages start to decline, they realized that something had to be done.  Cows4Kids is a result.  Contact us and join the revolution:
hello@cowsforkids.com
 

 
Why We Are Different 
The beauty of giving an animal to a village, is that it is self-sustaining.  These animals will have babies that will have babies, providing unlimited generations with nutrient-dense ancestral nourishment.  This is not a handout.  Further, none of these animals require feed in these regions, as they graze on the wild plants.  The communities supported by Cows 4 Kids have a heritage of animal rearing, and already maintain the skills to keep vibrantly healthy animals. 
 


 
Maasai Village
The Maasai live in Tanzania in the valley of Kilimanjaro.  Their traditional diet includes raw milk, blood, goat meat, beef, and herbal tea.  Although the children have their traditional diets at home, they are fed vegetable oil, corn, and beans at school.  For this Maasai village, 10 cows and 20 goats are needed for the school to provide a proper Maasai lunch.
 
Chagga Village
The Chagga live on Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania.  Their traditional diet includes fresh glacial water, milk, butter, goat meat, beef, chicken, fish, eggs, banana, taro, avocado, mango, sorghum, and millet.  In the last hundred years, maize has replaced sorghum.  With this initiative, our goal is to promote proper processing of maize using the five-stage process.  This process is necessary to avoid pellagra and malnutrition.  In addition, we aim to provide enough chickens, goats, and cows to feed the children their traditional diet while at school.  Currently, they are being fed a gruel comprised of unprocessed maize, beans, and water.  For this Chagga village, 20 cows, 30 goats, and 60 chickens are needed.
 
Batwa Village
The Batwa are in a unique situation in Uganda, as they have been displaced by the 1991 Bwindi National Park laws.  Traditionally living as hunter gatherers, the Batwa have always maintained perfect health.  However, as they are now displaced, they can no longer procure their food from hunting, and their health is rapidly declining.  They are in urgent need of livestock.  For this Batwa village, 20 cows, 50 goats, and 60 chickens are needed.

Hello Everyone!
 
Thank you so very much for your support of Cows4kids.com!  We have some very exciting updates for you!  


We have hit our initial goal of $12,000!!  This means that with your help, we are now able to feed all three villages and provide them livestock to feed their children their traditional diets!  I am in contact with all three villages, and they are over the moon!!  
Animals are being purchased this month to be delivered to the villages.  We will have a video made of the process to share with you all after the event!

Thank you again for touching the lives of so many, and for bringing animal based nutrition far and wide!
 
Mary

basic_story.tagline: Overconsumption in Developed Countries vs Insufficient Food Distribution in Central America
basic_story.story:
A few years ago, my good friend Richard Tazzara came up with a series of toys, where he inflated plastic figures to extrapolated measures to make them look really large. I  liked those toys and now as years have passed, I am inspired to create my own series “Fat So What?!” where superheroes from comics are exaggerated to heavy bodies. In these times, we embrace each other as we are and encourage love and empathy first. Inclusivity is great, after all – Santa Claus and Snowman are perfect just the way they are! But where do we draw the line between body positivity and unhealthy lifestyles? Where Is it a personal choice and where is it a consequence of social-economical impact?We’re seeing some interesting trends in commercial campaigns within different industries where plus-size models are finally being celebrated in the body positivity movement. But in the other side encouragement to consume unhealthy food is ever present. For many corporations and big businesses sale of these products is the easy obvious way to create millions in profits. But again, it’s in high demand! Here then, another question: how does this demand take place ?Are we deceiving ourselves? Giant corporations like Coca Cola and McDonald’s are the   sponsors for most of sports events around the world. We all know that usually the least expensive items in the supermarkets are fizzy drinks, frozen foods, and extra sweet delights. Coca Cola costs less than simple purified water. All of these items contain excessive amounts of high fructose corn syrup, potassium, sodium, trans fat, preservatives, who knows what else?Low-income neighborhoods are disproportionately affected by lack of access to healthy foods. Is it a lack of education, social background, local and federal authorities’ interests? It’s not surprising that the main goal of any enterprise is to generate profit, but I believe that the health of  people should come first. These thoughts inspired me to create the “Fat, So What?!” series to explore the depths of this dilemmas. To extend my discourse about excessive consumption in America and other wealthy countries, I’m embarking on a bicycle trip from Mexico to Costa Rica, 2500km! 40 days. I will start pedalling from Acapulco on February 13 and will be arriving in San Jose , Costa Rica on or around March 26th.I’ll Bicycle for equal healthy food access across the world. During this trip, I’ll be meeting a lot of people from rural and underdeveloped urban areas. These regions have scarce access to food distribution. Hence, I would like to unite our forces to show these people some love and care. I’m setting up a fundraising campaign on Indiegogo to raise money that I will donate to individuals and families that I meet during my trip through Mexico, Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador, Costa Rica and Nicaragua. 2500 kilometers - $2,500 is the goal of the Indigogo campaign. In addition, while on the trip, 50% of sales from the “Fat, So What?!” series will be donated to this cause as well!The fundraising campaign starts NOW and you have 7 weeks to contribute until the end of my trip. Each dollar that you send, I’m going to give to a person or a family during my trip in the form of cash ,grocery purchases and other goods. I’m sure they will be very happy with this help and I’ll be documenting all of that to share it with you! 
Learn more about the series on my Instagram: @denisouch

0.question: How would be the accumulated funds distributed?
0.answer: I'll be donating money, fresh and healthy groceries and other goods to people in need who I meet during this bicycle trip. It won't be just one family, it will be many people within the countries of Central America that I'm going to bike through.

basic_story.tagline: Help Gross National Happiness USA conduct the first 50-state US Happiness Report
basic_story.story:
The US Happiness Survey
Gross National Happiness USA (GNHUSA) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit established in 2009 with a mission to increase personal happiness and our collective well-being by changing how we measure progress and success. GNHUSA is part of the growing global happiness movement to establish an optimistic, just and practical path forward. The time has come to move beyond the single-focused GDP (Gross Domestic Product) model of production and consumption and focus on holistic measures of well-being.
In order to advocate for measures that focus more squarely on well-being, we are launching the first-ever U.S. Happiness Survey, a random-sampled, 50-state survey that asks the basic questions about how people rate their own lives. The US Happiness Survey will follow in the footsteps of the World Happiness Survey, drawing a random sample of respondents from each of the 50 states and then ranking the states based on how happy their residents are.
In order for us to conduct this survey, we will be partnering with survey research professionals who will help us make sure our survey meets the scientific rigor of random sampling. We are raising funds to pay these researchers.

What We Need
Gross National Happiness USA will be partnering with the research firm Prodege. If you contribute to this project, we will make sure to recognize you in the final report we publish on this survey.

The Impact
Gross National Happiness has hosted happiness conferences, promoted grassroots programs such as the Charter for Happiness and World Happiness Day Happiness Dinners, and even hosted a 10,000-mile walk across the country asking over 3,000 people what happiness means to them. This will be the first time we will be conducting a randomized survey of the country, though, making this in some ways our most ambitious project yet.

Risks & Challenges
Some states are smaller than others, so we will have to work harder to get enough survey questions administered in those states. We are working with Prodege to make sure that we have a good sample from each of the 50 states.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Below are other things you can do to support the cause.

Sign up for our newsletter.
Sign the Charter for Happiness.
Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

0.question: Where will my money go?
0.answer: The funds will be spent on the U.S. Happiness Survey, paying researchers to design and implement a survey of the entire country about self-assessed well-being.

basic_story.tagline: Aloha ~ join the movement to buy land where we will grow a food forest & healing center in Hawai'i!
basic_story.story:
Gardens of Eatin’ Artists’ Residency and SOL
island sanctuary + healing arts centre
Aloha! My name is Ishle Yi Park and I am a mother, gardener, hula dancer with Halau Hula Ka Makani Hali 'Ala O Puna, lomi lomi practitioner, certified yoga teacher, award~winning writer, and the first woman to be named Poet Laureate of Queens, New York. For the past 12 years, I've been blessed to live in Hawai'i, and my campaign is to help raise funds to purchase land on the Big Island where we can live and create a healing center, artists' residency and food forest for our island community.
​Become Part of Our Dream!
With your collective help, we can grow and build a sanctuary here on the islands where artists can come to rest, renew and recharge their creative batteries, as well as give back to da 'aina with regenerative, sustainable, and organic gardening practices. We invite you to join the collective movement to co~create a healthier, more natural and abundant tomorrow for our keiki with your actions today! 
*
Curated by poet, musician, mama, and educator Ishle Yi Park, Gardens of Eatin’ Artists Sanctuary is an BIPOC artists’ residency in Hawai’i open to local & visiting artists and invited guests.The sanctuary will be composed of an organic garden, herbal medicine wheel, two round garden studios for short~term artist residencies, BIPOC eco~poetics reading room, yoga & lomi lomi massage room, smoothie, cacao and tea bar and recording studio ~ will be open to artists who are granted residencies in the garden studios.

What We Need & What You Get
Let me break it down for ya'll in more detail:

What We Need: While we already have some seed money to start, the funds raised from this campaign will go towards ensuring that we purchase a large enough land for this vision ~ ideally a 1-3 acre parcel of partially cleared land so that we can start building and growing as soon as possible. We already have an ideal location on our radar and are in talks with real estate agents about this property, which is why time is of the essence.Funds will also go towards building our first three round structures, one for my family, one for the healing room (massage & lomi lomi), and one for the artist / guest residency, and the solar, water, and plumbing for these hales.Additional funds will go towards land clearing, hot tub, and planting seeds, starts & trees for our medicine wheels, lei and la'au la'pa'au gardens and permaculture food forest with a focus on native plants. You are welcome to bless us with funds for specific trees if you like ~ i.e., if you want to fund the planting of a koa tree, or a mango tree, you can do that, or if you'd like to bless us with enough to get an entire yurt ~ wonderful! It's up to you how you give ~ all blessings graciously accepted with gratitude & aloha.  
What You Get: If you give us funds for a mango tree, we will allow you to come visit & eat da fruit from this tree when it eventually fruits! You will be first in line to learn about our retreats & offerings on this property, and will be given opportunities to participate in the growth of this center as it unfolds!As contributors, donors, angels & patrons of the arts, you are welcome to visit Lani's Gardens of Eatin' Artists' Sanctuary when you are on the Big Island once it is complete.  Here is what the full vision for the land includes & what you can enjoy:  Lani’s Smoothie, Tea & Cacao Cafe & Library: will feature Lani's delicious organic smoothies, teas, and cacao elixirs, sell artworks made by artists in residency & provide a lending library of quality books for children & adults. 
Khaya ~ House of Song Music Studio : Artists in residence and other local musicians may work & record in this humble yet professional quality round music studio yurt that will feature music created to offer soothing benefits to listeners (some of this music will be created & recorded in the music studio).SOL Space for Performances, Salons & Acoustic Concerts, and Farm~to~Table Meals ~  A Community space will be designed for dinners & acoustic concerts, readings, intimate gatherings & community workshops.
Artist Residency Studios: Designed to serve artists, activists, musicians, and front~line cultural workers, these round short term artists residency spaces would host 1-2 artists at a time. Artists will have access to the music studio for recording & performance.
Organic Vegetable Garden: A good portion of the ‘Aina will be dedicated to abundant organic vegetable & herb gardens, including an herbal medicine wheel, a lei garden & la’au la pa’au garden. We also envision a permaculture paradise with edible fruits & flowers. The garden will be tended by Lani, her Ohana & resident artists, and volunteers.  



The Impact
This artists’ residency & healing center is designed to serve a very real need among Hawaii, mainland & international BIPOC musicians, artists, and cultural workers & allies, by providing artist~led space to gather, share ideas, and practice regenerative gardening. Our vision is to make this 'aina be a valuable resource for local Hawaiian healers and hula dancers from local halaus like Halau Hula Ka Makani Hali 'Ala O Puna to harvest medicine and traditional hula regalia for ceremony, as well as for our children and our children's children to enjoy the fruits of our farming, and a space where artists & musicians can come to gather, celebrate, connect & give back to the natural world. 
Here are some of the things that I'm envisioning on this land:
-writing workshops
-hula & yoga classes
-organic cooking workshops
-lomi lomi sessions
-marketing consultations
-gardening & coconut weaving workshops
- Hawaiian culture workshops from Hawaiian elders 
-workshops for na keiki o ka 'aina (children) 
-music studio for community
- and a round yurt (traditional Mongolian style, to pay respect to my ancestors) that would be available for local & visiting artists, friends, and family. 
*In the past, I have served as the Arts-In-Education Director of the Asian American Writers' Workshop, the Artist in Residence at Youth Speaks, and have been a creative writing & music teacher, poet, activist organizer for over 20 years.  I studied massage at the Hawaii Healing Arts School in Oahu, and lomi lomi with Kumu Dane Silva, and am certified in hot stones and detox massage. I received my 200 RYT Yoga Certification from Cloud Nine Yoga at Hawaiian Sanctuary.I have created numerous flourishing gardens from scratch on private farms and estates here on the Big Island when I have worked as a property manager, gardener, woofer, and work~trader, and I have a Certification in Sustainable Farming from Kauai Community College and recently completed the FAM (Farm Apprentice Mentorship) Program at UH Maui, learning from Maui's best organic farmers, so this vision is in total alignment with my life's purpose, which is to create a safe space for learning, growth, creativity, healing and the flourishing of nature. It is time I put all of these skills to practical use to serve my ohana and my community and help green the earth ~ "seed by seed, tree by tree", as I sing in my song, 'Aloha 'Aina'. I am committed to this vision which I have held dear to my heart for over a decade, and given recent world events, it is absolutely crucial and necessary for us, ESPECIALLY as mothers, Asian Americans, and people of color, to have food sovereignty and to learn how to self~sustain and live independently from a system that does not always nourish or sustain us in healthy or positive ways.It is up to us to learn from our ancestors and remember & recreate a way of living more in harmony and balance with the earth, which is of course, an ancient way ~ a return to roots and a simpler way of co~existing with our natural world. With God's help and the help of our beloved community, near and far ~ we trust that we can mana~fest this vision for the greater good. 

Of course, we will naturally encounter risks and obstacles on the way to achieving our goal.One thing we do not want is too many chefs in the kitchen making this complicated, so for this reason, we will keep it small & family run, so Gardens of Eatin’ Artists’ Sanctuary and SOL will not be co-operatively curated or managed or long term housing for other artists or tenants. It will be a gathering space for musicians, artists, activists & creatives, and a site for healing & planning retreats that serves API, BIPOC, native Hawaiian artists, activists, musicians, local families and traditional healers & builders. I am confident that with hard work, focus, prayer, communication, and aloha, we can overcome any hurdles that appear in our path. Mahalo nui loa e malama pono.
Have Fun at Our Campaign!While we’re asking for your support, we also want you to enjoy what we have put together. Check out our perks for various levels of donations. We work together with many other artists, such as the talented musicians behind the digital albums we offer as a thank-you-gift. So by donating to our campaign you will also support them. If you enjoyed our campaign video, and our launch event, stay tuned: There may be more where they came from! Most importantly, even if you can’t donate, please help us spread the word!

If you just can't contribute $$ right now, you can STILL help! Here's how: 

Ask folks to get the word out and make some waves about your campaign.
Share with your more affluent friends who are patrons of the arts! 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.I am humbly asking for your kokua in growing these gardens, developing this property, gently clearing, planting an abundance of edible fruit, and building sustainably. We've already begun steps to purchase this property and talked to investors. If you don't have access to kala, please share this campaign widely on social media. If you help get us there, I'll be happy to celebrate with you when the doors open for our launch celebration.Together We Can, and with God's Help & CommUnity ~ Everything is Possible! Thank you *  Aloha * Sarang * Namaste *Ishle Yi ParkFirst Woman Poet Laureate of Queens, NY Recipient, Sister of Fire Award, Women of Color Resource Center, CA Author, The Temperature of This Water Author, Angel & Hannah www.ishleyipark.com *From the Team:When we came across Ishle’s vision, we shared in everyone's immediate enthusiasm for this very achievable goal: to bring more community arts, locally grown organic food and healing services to the Big Island, led by the warmth, dedication and aloha of Ishle Yi Park. As witnesses of her work in the fields of literature, music, education, and community organizing, we know that she will indeed WORK! We are asking you join us as we support Ishle aka Lani in doing all that she does best in her home*sweet*home on the Big Island.Our goal for the building of the first two round dwellings + gardens is $50,000. However, in our collective support with You, we can go further and raise 100k! We can do this! Let's do this together for Lani and her Gardens of Eatin’ (#GardensofEatin’), to create a food forest, healing center and artist residency to serve the greater good.  Sincerely,Taiyo Na, Artist & Educator Sarah Ha, Educator Tyrell Blaquemoss, Artist Samantha Thornhill, Award~winning WriterTamika (Georgia Me) Harper, Emy Award Winning HBO Def Poet Kumu Hula Ali'i Kahuna Nui Ehulani Stephany, Halau Hula Ka Makani Hali 'Ala O Puna

Aloha! Every morning , I rise & meditate & say my gratitudes. Lately, I have so many good people to thank from across the country for supporting out farmraiser that it literally brings tears of joy to my eyes!



Thank you to every single angel who has blessed our family ~ sometimes as a single mama it's tough, and you don't know how you're gonna make it & provide enough for your beloved ohana...it really does take a village! Deep gratitude and appreciation to our newest angels ~ Walter Beasley, Sharon Kim, Sun Yung Shim, Mika Kasuga, John Forest Bellinger, and Tyrell Blaquemoss!  



And I am immensely, truly grateful beyond words for all the beloved friends, family members, hanai ohana, gardeners, round house dwellers, earth lovers,, poets, mama's, aunties, & visionary sistas and braddahs stepping up & showing up to give advice, show support & help us grow a home * sweet * home ~ who show their Aloha through their actions, because YES, Love is a Verb, and yes, you are showing me that whether you are near or far, you are a BEING of Love, and you are my beloved village, and we are held, loved, and supported by dear caring souls in Hawai, NY, Minnesota, Arizona, California, and more!



There are tears of joy and gratitude in my eyes right now as I write this. The grandmother spider in me is glowing & warmed by our connections & our luminous network of caring & love. Seed by seed, tree by tree, we are growing together!!



With your collective help, we have already purchased over 25 plants for our food forest, started talking with expert cacao growers on island who are helping us with our journey, and have raised $3k in 3 weeks!!! Yes!! Akua bless!



What began as a dream, a prayer, and a wish is blossoming into a collective grassroots movement, with over 40 team members & angel donors of all walks of life, colors of the rainbow & ages coming together to co~create, grow, and build. I will be featuring more of y'all this week. Saranghe & Gomahwuhyo.
 


Givings thanks & praise to our Great Creator, to our beautiful island, to the plants & the people & the healing & the music that make Life wonder~full.
I Love You and I am BLESSED to Be Here on God's green earth with You.


Thank you & ALOHA always!!



ps ~ I wrote a song for You called 'Home in My Heart' & am currently making a thank you video right now with all your beautiful faces in it cuz I'm emo like that, haha ~ will be ready hopefully by Christmas! Saranghe!!

basic_story.tagline: Scroll Down - Contribute to Research! Mold in Mattress? Outdoor Stachybotrys? DNA (ERMI) Inhibition?
basic_story.story:
Research into Mold Contamination in Homes 
Studies have shown that up to 25% of the population might develop a hypersensitive to mold. However many don't realize anyone can have adverse reactions to buildings with high levels of mold contamination. Research has shown that water damaged buildings often cause major impacts to health and well being. What isn't always so clear -- is how to return a contaminated building to a normal safe, healthful and nurturing environment. Currently the conventional wisdom is that hard surfaced items with settled spores or fungal fragments can easily be cleaned. But many questions remain. 
 

Author & Researcher - John C. Banta
Certified Industrial Hygienist and Author John Banta has worked professionally for the last 30 years investigating indoor environmental quality problems in homes and work environments. His first book Prescriptions for a Healthy House: A Practical Guide for Architects, Builders and Homeowners was co-authored with Architect Paula Baker-LaPorte and MD Erica Elliott and is now in its third edition. John is currently working on a new book --Mold Controlled: A Practical Guide to Find, Avoid, and Fix Mold Problems in Water Damaged Homes.  The book is aimed at demystifying mold problems and how to return mold contaminated housing to the nurturing healthful environments we should have as home.

The Research
The funds raised by this campaign will support science based research to answer a number of important remaining issues: 

Can soft furnishings be effectively cleaned to remove mold spores, fungal fragments, and mycotoxins (toxins produced by mold)?
Which cleaning methods are effective, and which are not?
When should a contaminated mattress, sofa or other upholstered furnishing be discarded?
Are barrier covers such as those for dust mites effective in preventing re-contamination? 
Can barrier covers be used to provide protection when used on an already contaminated mattress?

In 2012 the Journal of Asthma, 49:139–143 Published a study: "Daily Vacuuming of Mattresses Significantly Reduces House Dust Mite Allergens, Bacterial Endotoxin, and Fungal β-Glucan." This study concluded "Daily vacuuming of mattresses significantly decreased levels of house dust mite allergens, endotoxin, and Fungal β-glucan. This method offers sensitized patients a cheaper option to reduce their exposure to bio-contaminants in their bed."
There are a number of questions that were not answered by the study:

Fungal β-glucan is found in the cell wall of molds. It is not specific to molds associated with water damage. Your contribution to this crowd-funding venture would be used to test for water damage associated molds using mold specific DNA (MSQPCR).
The study tested mattresses were HEPA vacuumed daily at a rate of one minute per square meter for eight weeks. At the end of the eight weeks the daily vacuuming had reduced the levels of dust mites, endotoxins and fungal glucans by approximately 85%. The study supported by your contribution would help answer the mold question using MSQPCR.
After the daily vacuuming was stopped the mattresses continued being monitored. Six weeks later the levels of allergenic dusts had returned to the pre-study levels. The contributions from this crowd-funding venture would be used to attempt to determine if levels climbed because high levels of the contaminated dust remained in the home and re-infested the mattress or if contaminants were buried deep in the mattress and re-worked their way to the surface.

It is estimated $1,650 of funds raised by this campaign would pay for laboratory analysis for one round of testing on one mattress.

Use of Extra Funds if the Project is Over-Funded
If this project is over-funded the extra contributions from this crowd-funding venture would be used for replicate studies, additional research and book production costs as follows:

The original study did not address mycotoxins. Is HEPA vacuuming effective in removing mycotoxins from contaminated fabrics, mattresses and upholstered furnishings?
If HEPA vacuuming is not effective for mattresses and upholstered furnishings, are there other effective methods that can be used?
If preliminary studies show that mold contaminated porous furnishings can be successfully restored, the studies will need to be replicated enough times to be sure that the results are real and not a fluke!
It is easy to decide what to do with gypsum walls that have visible growth, but how much extra material should be removed and discarded beyond the visible growth to be sure that actual growth has been eliminated?
Production costs for the book could include professional editing, illustrations, salaries, layout and design.



What We Need & What You Get
The MSQPCR panel used is known as ERMI. It measures the quantities of DNA identified for thirty-six specific genotypes of molds. Laboratory charges for the ERMI panel is $300 per sample. Predominant molds can be analysed as a panel for $150 for a panel of any five of the identified molds. 
Study One (We met our funding goal for Phase 1 of this study. The results have been posted on the secure Contributor Login section of my website)
The first study replicated the eight week mattress study using MSQPCR to identify the molds found in dust that can be vacuumed from the surface. The dust will be collected before cleaning begins and at two week intervals for the eight weeks of the study. The pre-study sample and the sample collected at the eighth week were analysed using the full ERMI panel. Samples collected at week 2, 4 and 6 were analysed for the most predominant water damage related species identified at the beginning of the study. After the eight weeks of vacuuming the mattress had core samples collected at depths of two, four, six, and eight inches for analysis of the predominant water damage related species deep in the cleaned mattress.
Study Two (Part one of the barrier cloth study has been funded and completed and posted in the Contributor Login section of my website, additional funds are needed for phase 2 which will repeat the study with barrier cloths that have been laundered)
This second study was able to capitalize on the first study since the mold contamination types and quantities were already determined by the pre-study MSQPCR sample. The effectiveness of multiple types of barrier cloths was be tested by placing the barrier on the contaminated mattress and determining the types and quantities of molds that were able to be vacuumed through the barrier cloth. The dust that was vacuumed through the barrier was be analysed using the same MSQPCR analysis used by the pre-study samples. The results showed that Dust Mite Barriers also help reduce mold contamination - but one type was superior to all the rest!
Study Three (If this campaign is over-funded)
The third study would be performed based on available funds and the identification of potential mycotoxin producing organisms in the mattresses. This third study will be able to capitalize on the first study since the mold contamination types and quantities will have already been determined by the pre-study MSQPCR sample. In those cases where one or more organisms that are capable of producing a target mycotoxins is present the actual level of mycotoxins present in the mattress would then be determined prior to and after an interval of HEPA vacuuming. Each mycotoxin test is $300 per sample. In addition to determining if mycotoxins could be removed from a mattress, layer testing would be used to determine the penetration of mycotoxins within the mattress. This study is currently on hold - until we find a mattress contaminated with mycotoxins that can be used.
Additional Studies May Be Suggested by the Results of the First Studies (If this campaign is over-funded)
Information about additional studies are posted in the Updates section of this site.
Research projects almost always result in additional questions. If the campaign is over-funded these additional studies can also be performed.
What You Get
Every contributor of $25 or more will be a part of our inner circle. This means you will be sent research updates that will  keep you informed about the research findings as they become available. You will also have access to the Mold Controlled book chapters as they are produced. You won't have to wait for formal publication to receive the information. 
This will help insure you have access to the most up-to-date mold remediation information available. You will continue to have on-line access to the book in draft form until your copy of the e-book is published and emailed to you. 
 

The Impact
Previous studies have left many unanswered questions about whether cleaning porous contents such upholstered furnishings and mattresses can be effective. Some methods are likely to work better than others and some measures may only be temporary. It is important for mold sensitive persons to know what methods of cleaning are effective and what methods are not. This will help people determine reasonable expectations for what can be achieved. In a number of cases people have discarded and replaced contaminated items, only to have the contamination reappear in brand new furnishings. Knowing which temporary measures are effective, such as barrier cloths will also help establish a temporary safe environment while decisions are made regarding remediation or relocation.
 

Risks & Challenges
Submission for Publication in a Peer Reviewed Journal
Most peer reviewed publications do not permit prior publication. As a contributor, you will be a part of the inner circle, so we will be able to keep you informed with progress updates as the studies move forward, but the formal publication of the book Mold Controlled will need to be delayed until after the research studies have been completed, peer reviewed and appeared in the selected journal(s). Journals typically do not want researchers to submit their findings to more than one publication at a time. Additional delays can occur whenever a journal rejects a submission and during the editing and peer review process. Further delays may occur when peer reviewers request additional information, reject content or request that submissions be rewritten. It is estimated this process could require two years before the published studies can be referenced in the book. As a contributor you will be provided an access code that you can use to review the draft chapters, and illustrations of the book as they are posted. Combined with routine research updates - this will help insure you have access to the most up-to-date mold remediation information available. You will continue to have on-line access to the book in draft form until your copy of the e-book is published and emailed to you.

0.update:
I have now posted the Ultimate Chapter on Contents Cleaning and Restoration for mold.  I believe the information in these chapters as a whole provides the most comprehensive information about our things and how to prevent, remediate, restore and preserve the items we own when they are affected by water damage, mold growth, settled spores and fragments. If you have yet to contribute - what are you waiting for? If you have already contributed $25 or more, you already know that the information in my chapters is level-headed and practical. If internet advice has you in a panic, now you have access to the following Chapters regarding Mold and our personal contents. 
-- Contents Cleaning and Restoration: This is the Newest Chapter. It goes in depth into the nature of our things and how to clean or address mold that has grown or settled on our things. 
-- About Our Things: You don't have to throw it all out! This chapter will help you decide how to stage, store and break the cycle of mold contamination on personal possessions whether you are moving, or putting your home back together after a mold disaster.
-- Cleaning Products: There is no need to spend a fortune on fancy mold cleaners. This chapter will help you understand what cleaners work and how to judge them for yourself. It also addresses the fallacy that killing mold makes it okay. 
-- Microfiber Cleaning Cloths: Forget about using rags to clean. Microfiber cloths will significantly reduce the amount of work and do a better job. This chapter covers how to decide if you should be using disposable or reusable Microfiber Cleaning Cloths and how to maintain them.
-- Laundry & Dry Cleaning: Removing mold contamination from most washables is easy - if you know how. When you finish this chapter - you will know how.
-- Moldy Mattresses: This chapter is largely based on research completed with your contributions. In it I explain what causes mattresses to become moldy and how to protect them and you from contamination.
-- Washers & Dryers: This Chapter tells you more than you ever thought you needed to know about washers and clothes dryers. These tools are real work horses when it comes to cleaning up mold in our things - but they only work if you know how to use them properly and effectively.
-- Vehicles: Many of us spend a lot of time in our car. This chapter tells you how to select, maintain and remediate mold in vehicles. 
Thank you again for your support and the positive feedback you have provided.
John C. Banta

1.name: by John Banta
1.update:
Here we are in a new year! Progress on the book continues to be at a much slower rate than I had ever anticipated. Approximately half is now posted in the Contributor Login section at my website at www.JohnCBanta.com, another quarter is mostly finished but undergoing the addition of some minor amounts of material and editing. The final quarter either remains to be written or needs major work. My current projection and goal is to have these other sections completed and posted by the middle of the year.
I am pleased to announce I have posted another chapter. This one is on vehicles. Here is the opening paragraph followed by the Chapter Subheadings:
Vehicles present special issues since they frequently get wet. In general, they are made from materials that are free of nutrients that support growth; however, the various things we transport such as carboard, paper, spilled foodstuff and tracked dirt may provide enough to allow growth if they get and stay wet. Cross contamination by transporting unprotected contaminated items may transfer sufficient spores and fragments to also make the passenger compartment unacceptable for mold sensitive persons. Fortunately, most of the problems can be avoided or corrected by choosing an automobile, van or truck that is easy to service and maintain. When choosing a car for ease of maintenance consider:
-- Carpeted floor mats tend to hold and hide dirt making them more difficult to clean than hard surfaced flooring. If present, carpet floor mats should be easy to remove and replace for cleaning.
-- Leather or vinyl seats are easier to effectively clean than soft porous materials.
-- Efficient cabin air filters should be present and easy to service and maintain. They should filter both the incoming outdoor air and also filter recirculated vehicle cabin air.
-- The vehicles Air Conditioning (AC) system should completely drain condensate from the vehicle when it is parked on level ground.
-- The AC system coils and condensation collection pan should be easy to access for inspection and cleaning.
The following are the headings in this Chapter:
-- Cleaning Vehicles with Settled Spores and Fragments
-- Mold Growth in Vehicles
-- Preventing Mold Growth in Vehicles
-- Rapidly Drying Wet Vehicles
-- Remediating Existing Mold Growth from VehiclesRecognizing Flooded Vehicles
-- Cabin Air Filter Replacement
-- Keeping a Vehicles AC System Dry When Not in Use

2.name: by John Banta
2.update:
About six months ago several colleagues shared that they suspected gypsum dust from wallboard could cause inhibition of the DNA results from ERMI analysis.
During my earlier inhibition study of 21 potential DNA inhibitors (See January 24, 2019 update) I had tested a sample of gypsum dust from wallboard and did not find any evidence of inhibition. Of course, different manufactures use different sources and recipes for their products. Based on the information from my colleagues, I felt it was important to figure out if gypsum wallboard dust can interfere with ERMI (MSQPCR) analysis of mold DNA.
What I have found is that my colleagues were correct! Some gypsum wallboard dust does cause inhibition of DNA analyzed using MSQPCR. I believe this may be at least in part because gypsum wallboard may contain varying amounts of clay. The published literature is quite clear that clay binds with the DNA and prevents its analysis using PCR. 
This has very important implications for post remediation sampling of homes using ERMI. The presence of clay in any residual gypsum dust, or from other sources, may interfere with the identification of remaining mold contamination. This could make it appear that a home has been successfully remediated when it has not! This further demonstrates the importance that laboratories analyzing for ERMI use quality control measures to help ensure that inhibition is being tested for with every sample analysis they perform and that when inhibition is found the sample results are noted as being inhibited so that nobody falsely assumes that the remediation efforts have been successful.
 Your support and contributions to Mold Research continue to allows us to fund studies necessary to help resolve some of the important issues regarding investigation of mold contamination in homes.
Thank you for your continued support!
John C. Banta

5.cmt_text:
My doctor referred me to John Banta to help test my living space for mold, since I have mold illness, and while he was here, he mentioned that while tyvek would make a good mattress and pillow cover, none exist on the market. (The reason it would make a good cover is that it’s breathable but the pores are small enough to prevent mold spores from crossing.)
I found a way to make my own pillow cover (that would work for mattresses too) and John asked me to post my findings here. (to be cont’d)

basic_story.tagline: Cereal for Dinner is an online hub, providing realistic resources for people with depression.
basic_story.story:
Summary
Website: cerealfordinner.org 
I am Emily, and I am an expert. Not the kind of expert I thought I'd be growing up, when I had plans to become a pediatrician (maybe an opera singer on the side). After my second year of medical school, I began an intensive "study" with depression, soon gaining "expert status." I felt so exhausted and deeply despondent that seemingly simple activities, such as making a sandwich, walking down the stairs, or taking out the trash required tremendous amounts of effort. Singing, an activity that had always brought me great joy and reprieve, had become a chore, reminding me of how far I had deviated from who I once was. Eventually, I made the decision to leave medical school, as my "depressive studies" left me little ability keep up with the rigors of medical training.

*Emily's natural habitat
Throughout my journey I've been consistently bombarded with messages from websites, doctors, and family to exercise (vigorously, 3-4 times/week), eat well (Mediterranean diet is most effective), find a fulfilling career/passion and a supportive community to belong to. This, combined with medications and therapy, would help to alleviate my depression and I would achieve Ultimate Recovered Patient Status. My name would basically be in lights at my therapist's office. 

I am very aware that suggestions are all evidence-based and well-meaning. However, the problem with the depressed mind is that 1. we often have so little hope of getting better that we don't even want to try anymore, or 2. we just don't care about ourselves at all, or 3. we want to get better but have no clue where to start. A depressed person needs specific resources for 1. how to simply get by when they are at their worst and 2. how to start moving toward wellness in a realistic, achievable way.
Cereal for Dinner is an online platform that provides these resources. It "meets you where you're at" by stratifying resources based on how you're doing. Need easy recipes that you can make in ~5 min just so that you're eating something? Use the "depression-friendly" recipe directory that offers filters based on effort level, implements used, etc. Do you currently have a job but need to figure out how to get by during a depressive episode? Check out that section in the "Occupational/Educational" section.
 
16.1 million people are diagnosed with depression each year, and this is only growing with the pandemic. We as a society need to not only offer affordable, culturally-competent care (see the Care Access page), but we also need to ensure that individuals with depression are equipped with the resources to cope with the disease and take attainable steps to get better. Cereal for Dinner does just that.
 

What We Need & What You Get
Your contribution will go toward the following initiatives: 

Continuing to expand and update resources on the existing Cereal for Dinner website
Recognizing that one's experience with depression can be vastly different than another's, especially among individuals from systemically underserved backgrounds, we are committed to creating an Advisory Team with a diversity of lived experiences, backgrounds, and identities.
Marketing initiatives (including SEO and Google ads) to ensure the website reaches as many people as possible
Development of a corresponding app, which will:
Offer community forums based on the resources offered and user interest, in order to build community
Develop a group chat program, where users can speak with clinicians and/or peers about topics that are rarely offered, such as Coping with Treatment-Resistant Depression, Keeping Up with Hygiene, and Living with Depression When You're Struggling Financially
Create a weekly live community meeting, where a speaker can tell their story and offer hope to those who are struggling, along with a community meditation breakout discussions
Offer depression-specific, evidence-based tracks led by experts which will assist the user in developing wellness goals in a step-wise format



 

The Impact
Cereal for Dinner has the capacity to assist thousands, if not millions of individuals living with depression and in-need of extra support, with its website alone. Its future corresponding app will allow for future engagement community, validation, and hope. So many have been impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, and many have been struggling with depression/bipolar depression for many years before the pandemic began. Your contribution will be essential for creating a new way of looking at depression care, and assisting those who are "depression experts" like me.
 

Risks & Challenges
Risk #1: Not having the funding to sustain the projects in store for Cereal for Dinner. 
How It's Being Addressed: 

Utilizing existing network of mental health professionals that I have worked with in a professional capacity in the past.
Reaching out to relationships with existing popular mental health forums and newsletters.
Currently applying for a number of incubator programs that assist startups in thinking through challenges and gathering an appropriate team of experts to give us the best chance for success

Risk #2: I have never run an organization of this magnitude before.
How It's Being Addressed:

I am fortunate to work with an incredibly talented and experienced Advisory Team with vast knowledge of mental health and entrepreneurship, such as the Associate Chief Medical Officer of Brigham and Women's Hospital and the former Director of Psychological Services at the University of Pennsylvania, to name a few. 
This is not my first foray into running organizations in the mental health field. At the University of Pennsylvania, I founded the school's first in-person peer counseling program, Penn Benjamins, which is still running 7 years later, and at Brown Medical School I assisted in running the free clinic and founded their first free psychiatry clinic.
I assisted with starting up the first pediatric non-profit in Massachusetts, Boston Community Pediatrics.
I have a degree in Health & Societies from the University of Pennsylvania, a Masters in Medical Science from Brown, and am nearly finished with an additional Masters in Population Medicine, so I have experience with population-based solutions to health problems.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to donate, there are many ways you can help:

If you have any particular skill that may be relevant to Cereal for Dinner that you'd be willing to donate your time to (i.e. social media (!!), SEO, resource gathering, web design, app design, etc.)
We will likely be starting a blog in the near future, and would welcome contributions.
You could share this campaign with friends/colleagues: Facebook: Cereal For Dinner, Instagram: @cerealfordinner.official, Twitter: @cereal4dindin, LinkedIn: Cereal for Dinner

1.answer: No! Cereal for Dinner is often used as an adjunct to therapy, however. The premise behind Cereal for Dinner is to provide additional resources that a person can use to cope with depression, and take steps toward getting better.

basic_story.tagline: Discover your best career option while empowering the careers of veterans & students of color
basic_story.story:
EMPOWER YOUR CAREER... and the Careers of Vets, Minority Students, and 1st Generation College StudentsCAREER CLARIFIER is a revolutionary career clarity test developed to help college students and graduates (in all stages of their careers) quickly identify their best career options so they can have jobs they love and achieve their professional potential.We also have an audacious social impact goal to support the career success of 100,000 college students who are either veterans, attending a Historically Black College or University (HBCU) or Hispanic Serving Institute (HSI), or are the 1st person in their family to attend college (1st generation college student).That’s where you come in. We need your backing to launch our new career clarity test. For every test we sell, our social mission is to provide a free career clarity test to a veteran, student of color, 1st generation college student to help them achieve the professional success and financial self-sufficiency they want and deserve.  WHAT PROBLEM DOES CAREER CLARIFIER SOLVE?Despite spending tens of thousands of dollars (or more) on their college education, more than half of college graduates don’t know what career they would enjoy and excel in. Many take whatever job they land after graduating, and often waste years (or decades) of their life stuck in unfulfilling jobs.Career Clarifier is unlike any other career test. Here’s why: All the popular career tests today suggest careers primarily based on personality. The flaw with that methodology is that personality determines HOW we do our job but not WHAT job we should do.Think for a moment about the sharks on the hit tv show Shark Tank. They all have the same job - business leader and investor- but their personalities are wildly different.Instead of personality, it’s their ability to size up an entrepreneur, analyze a market, understand the financials of a business, and structure a profitable deal.  It’s their skills, knowledge, and abilities that make them great at their careers.Career Clarifier, unlike other career tests, primarily uses a person’s skills, knowledge, and interests (and a bit of personality) to identify career options that truly fit.Our career clarity test is the perfect solution for:
Students in university / college getting ready for the working world
A recent college grad still looking for the right job / career
A not-so-recent college grad feeling stuck in their career 
Experienced working professionals looking to make a career transition 
High school students thinking about what they want to major in during college
  THIS CAMPAIGN ADDRESSES A CRITICAL SOCIAL PROBLEMMost college students and graduates don't know about the 1,000+ different careers that exist.While veterans, people of color, and 1st generation college students have big dreams and strong motivation, they typically have less knowledge of the professional careers available to them to help them achieve their full potential. Many will get stuck in unsatisfying jobs that don’t let them achieve their potential.That’s why for each career test we sell at Career Clarifier, we will donate a career test to a veteran who is enrolled in college, a student at an HCBU or HSI, or a 1st generation college student.When you back this campaign, you’ll be helping people you know personally who need career support, and we will be able to provide the Career Clarifier to three traditionally underserved populations so they can have inspiring careers and be heroes to people in their communities.Because of your support, they will be the example that other people will look to and think, “I can do that with my career too.”   CAREER CLARIFIER IS EASY TO USEPeople can use their computer, laptop, tablet, or smartphone to answer 80 multiple choice questions about skills, knowledge, and interests.Our proprietary platform will compare their answers to an in-depth analysis of more than 1,000 jobs and careers geared toward people with college degrees. Each test taker instantly receives a comprehensive, 90-page results report, which can be saved, downloaded and/or printed.The personalized results report includes:
The test taker's preferred skills, knowledge, and abilities
20 specific jobs and careers that best fit the test taker
Comprehensive Career Summary Profiles that describe each recommend job
Detailed information on how to evaluate the career options and choose the best one
Work settings the test taker will enjoy working in based on their interests
How to choose the right career for you
 ABOUT METhe past 17 years of my life have been dedicated to helping college students and college graduates to identify their best career options, so they don’t waste years of their life job hopping from one unsatisfying job to another.In 2004, I founded a career clarity coaching service that helps college students and college graduates to identify their best career options. More than 7,000 people have used my 1 to 1 coaching service to identify career paths they will enjoy, excel in and be proud of.For the past two years, I have been building a revolutionary online career clarity test that will provide career clarity to people who don’t have access to expensive 1 to 1 career coaching.Working with a technical co-founder, we’ve designed and built a proof-of-concept model that has been tested and fine-tuned with more than 500 of my clients. I’ve gotten their feedback and suggestions on how to improve our system and results report.I’ve also spent the past eighteen months writing comprehensive summary profiles for more than 1,000 careers to help users learn the details about each recommended option. The career clarity test is set for October 1, 2021 release.I’ve been self-funding all this work and product development. It’s an investment I feel privileged and proud to have been able to make.Now, I need your help.  The more we raise, the more tests we can provide right now. Ultimately, our goal is to provide 100,000 free tests.  FOUR WAYS YOU CAN HELP LAUNCH THIS REVOLUTIONARY CAREER CLARITY TESTIf empowering the career success of people you know, as well as traditionally underserved people, moves you, here are four things you can do today:
Back this campaign now: Get a career test for you (or someone you know) and provide a career clarity test a veteran, student of color, or 1st generation college student.
Help a friend: Please share this link with friends who would benefit from career guidance.
Help spread the word: Share this project with someone you know who is also passionate about seeing underserved people succeed.
Help us get media exposure: Share this project with your media contacts.
 WHAT YOUR GENEROSITY WILL DOYour generosity will help unleash the career potential of graduating veterans, minority students, and 1st generation college students.  With your generosity, you'll receive a career clarity test that you (or someone you know) can take... and we will donate a free career clarity test to help them see their best career possibilities and achieve their full personal and professional potential.You and I have the power to use our influence and financial resources for good - and in this case, to make a difference in the lives of so many others. Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!

basic_story.tagline: Fusing Fashion with Health Using Copper Alloy Jewelry
basic_story.story:
Hello, my name is Alyssa Taylor, and I am currently a three month resident artist at the Baltimore Jewelry Center, and creator of Armóur Jewelry. 
I have created a line of copper and copper alloy jewelry that makes use of healing and environmentally sustainable metal. I am starting this campaign to bring awareness to the health benefits of copper and also scale this collection so that it will be available to the global community. My goal is to raise $10,000.
About Armóur
A perfect fusion of fashion and health, Armóur lives and functions as artfully-inspired copper and copper alloy adornment,  Armóur is born out of the intense desire to bring awareness to the various health benefits of copper and transdermal micro-nutrition while also delivering totally stunning wearable art designs. Transdermal micro-nutrition is a process in which the copper metal reacts with the skin to create a bio-salt that is then absorbed through the skin. 
This reaction is important to distinguish because copper is a trace mineral that our body needs to function properly.
About The Creator:
As an artist dedicated to my craft of design and jewelry making, I have completed metalsmith, wax-working, casting, and digital design classes to enhance my work and design skills. I also have had my work featured in a short film entitled "Not That Nice," about an artist who is learning to balance the call of her heart versus conforming to society.
I am a multimedia artist, innovator, creator, and designer. I love to create art of all types using my voice, music, movement, and adornment. I have a passion and enthusiasm for health and improving the health of the global environment by making thought provoking pieces and making them beautiful and interesting enough to grab anyone's attention.
Since 2017, I have been designing jewelry. I started out making copper nose cuffs and ear cuffs for myself. Eventually, enough people began to ask if I sold them, and so many people expressed their admiration for my pieces that I decided to start a business. I secretly started the nose cuff trend with my copper nose cuffs. I had not seen them anywhere before I started making them.
 

What We Need To Launch This Collection
My Goal is to Raise $10,000 for this business in order to scale this collection, reach a global audience, and trademark a process that I invented involving wax-working and prototyping designs.
Your contribution will go toward:
Trademarking fees
Legal Consultation
Patenting Fees
Administrative Fees
Raw Materials
Mold Making of Prototypes 
3-D Scans of Prototypes
Laser Cutting and Casting Fees
YouTube Channel Equipment To Teach About Copper Alloys and Jewelry Making
Adspend to reach customers who resonate with this work.
Your Support Will Help To Make An Impact:

Armóur will help to bring awareness to the public on the various health benefits of copper and transdermal micro-nutrition. It is normal for copper, a healing precious metal, to produce a green reactive salt on the skin. Most people have a negative perception toward this process because of misinformation and misidentification of metals. However, this process is completely natural and healthy, and is called transdermal micro-nutrition, in which the metal reacts with the skin to create a bio-salt that is then absorbed through the skin. Additionally, copper is EPA classified as one of the only metals that is antimicrobial, antiviral, and can continuously kill viruses that it comes into contact with including the virus that causes COVID-19. 
You can read more about the antiviral effects of copper on the EPA's website: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/epa-registers-...
The use of copper material is deliberately chosen with our health in mind. Wearing copper can help to alleviate a variety of copper deficient ailments. Copper can help to alleviate pain in arthritis, improve cognitive function, and help with detoxification. In fact, many health-forward people buy copper jewelry for the healing, metaphysical, and energetic properties.
Copper is Sustainable
Copper is the world's most reusable resource. Sustainable mining practices and 100% recyclability add to the value and importance of copper. Worldwide, global resources are estimated to amount to 5.8 trillion pounds, which only about 0.7 trillion pounds (12%) have been mined throughout history. Nearly all of what has been mined is still in circulation. The ability to reuse copper extracted from recycled product is a tribute to the industry and preserves the use of natural resources.
The U.S. is completely self-sufficient in its production of copper and does not rely on foreign copper.
Copper Alloys Used In This Collection:
My pieces are distinctively designed copper and copper alloy jewelry and adornment beneficial to humankind and the environment. My newest collection of pieces consist of ear cuffs and rings, electro-formed in copper, cast in bronze, and yellow and white brass.

Ways You Can Help
You Can Support The Launch of The Armóur Copper Alloy Collection By:

Donating To The IndieGoGo Crowdfunding Campaign 
Sharing This Campaign With As Many People As You Can on Social Media
Follow Armóur On IG: @artbyarmour
Buy A Piece of Jewelry
Become a Member of My Website: www.artbyarmour.com

Contact me at info@artbyarmour.com
